did.unittitle:
Warren Washburn Florer pamphlets and reprints
undated and 1900-1932
did.langmaterial: The material is in English and German

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Warren Washburn Florer pamphlets and reprints, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Warren W. Florer was a professor of German at the University of Michigan.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of pamphlets and reprints of articles written by Warren W. Florer. The collection has been gathered together from different sources.

did.unittitle: A guide for the Study of Heyse's L'Arrabbiata with Questions for Grammar Review, 1900
A Guide for the Study of Riehl's Burg Neideck and von Jagemann's German Syntax, 1900
Questions on Thomas's Grammar With Essentials of Grammar in German, 1903
Remarks on the Direct Method of Teaching German, 1903
Report of the Meeting of the Modern Language Association, 1904
The Importance of Contemporary German literature for the American student, 1905
Luther's use of the Pre-Lutheran Versions of the Bible, 1911
Luther's Use of the Bible in German Before 1522, 1912
The Liberty Meeting in Detroit, December, 1851, 1932
The American Revolution by Picture and Word, Ann Arbor and Michigan, undated
Gender-change from Middle High German to Luther, as seen in the 1545 edition of the Bible, undated
Luther's attitude toward language study, undated
Die Wichtigkeit der neuen deutschen Erziehund für America, undated
